vectorData.altText: 27. A patent processus vaginalis is the anatomical basis of a(n) _______________ inguinal hernia.
That is incorrect. Click here      to learn the answer, then come back to try again.
That's right!  An indirect inguinal hernia is caused by a patent processus vaginalis. Since it is a congenital problem, it is commonly present in babies and small children.

through a patent     processus vaginalis; it therefore has a congenital component to its formation.  
While the processus vaginalis is usually obliterated by birth, in some it may be partially or completely patent; this determines the extent of the hernia, which may extend though the entire length of the inguinal canal and into the scrotum or labium majus. 
Because an indirect inguinal hernia passes through the deep inguinal ring, it is therefore located lateral to the inferior epigastric vessels. 
Because the root of the problem is a patent processus vaginalis, indirect inguinal hernias commonly present as problems in babies and small children, usually male.
